title: Famous Forgeries
description: Notable art forgeries, document fakes, and counterfeiters

questions.question: Han van Meegeren was a famous Dutch forger who created fake paintings attributed to which Old Master?
The 'Hitler Diaries,' published in 1983, were exposed as forgeries created by whom?
The Piltdown Man, discovered in 1912, was a famous forgery in which field?
Frank Abagnale Jr., whose life was depicted in the movie 'Catch Me If You Can,' was known for forging what?
Mark Hofmann was an American forger and murderer who specialized in forging documents related to which religious group?
The 'Donation of Constantine,' a forged Roman decree, was proven false in the 15th century by which scholar?
Elmyr de Hory was a famous art forger who primarily forged works by which group of artists?
The 'Vinland Map,' once believed to prove Viking exploration of North America, is now widely considered to be what?
Eric Hebborn was a British art forger who wrote a manual about his craft. What was it called?
Clifford Irving wrote a fake autobiography of which reclusive billionaire in the early 1970s?
The Protocols of the Elders of Zion is a notorious forged document that originated in which country?
Beltracchi, one of the most prolific art forgers of the 21st century, is from which country?
What scientific technique, developed in the mid-20th century, has been instrumental in detecting forged paintings?
The 'Tiara of Saitaphernes,' purchased by the Louvre in 1896, turned out to be a forgery made of what material?
Han van Meegeren's forgeries were so convincing that one of his fake Vermeers was initially acquired by which Nazi leader?
